intro: Costaricaea, commonly known as the Costa Rican tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions. The plants are characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. They often grow in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Costaricaea species are valued for their ornamental qualities and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
